message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.NE 

This paper focuses on optical flow estimation using Convolution Neural Networks (CNNs), which is a common topic in computer vision (CV) research. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also proposes an unsupervised learning framework using Convolution LSTM, which falls under the category of machine learning (ML). Hence, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is the second likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the decoupling of motion feature learning and optical flow representation, which involves the use of artificial intelligence (AI) techniques. Therefore, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is the third likely sub-category. The paper also evaluates the proposed method on action recognition, which is a sub-topic of multimedia (MM) research. Hence, cs.MM (Multimedia) is the fourth likely sub-category. Finally, the paper uses a pyramid structure for optical flow estimation, which involves the use of neural networks (NNs). Therefore, cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is the fifth likely sub-category.
